unnormalised: EduTech Buzz: Virtual Classrooms - The New Normal?
normalised: EduTech Buzz: Virtual Classrooms - The New Normal?

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Seems like virtual classrooms are sticking around longer than that unexpected guest during Diwali. From IIT Delhi to tiny schools in Kerala, online learning is becoming super common. Remember those early days of buffering videos and awkward Zoom calls? We’ve come a long way!
normalised: Hey everyone! Seems like virtual classrooms are sticking around longer than that unexpected guest during Diwali. From I I T Delhi to tiny schools in Kerala, online learning is becoming super common. Remember those early days of buffering videos and awkward Zoom calls? We’ve come a long way!

unnormalised: Now, you've got teachers in Mumbai using interactive whiteboards and kids in Bangalore building virtual models for their science projects. Even smaller towns are catching up with better internet and affordable devices.
normalised: Now, you've got teachers in Mumbai using interactive whiteboards and kids in Bangalore building virtual models for their science projects. Even smaller towns are catching up with better internet and affordable devices.

unnormalised: Many argue it’s not just about lectures anymore. Some schools are even organizing virtual Onam celebrations, complete with online Pookalam contests!

unnormalised: Of course, challenges remain. Access to devices and stable internet is still a big issue, especially in rural areas. And let's be honest, staring at a screen all day can be exhausting.

unnormalised: But overall, virtual classrooms are changing the game in education. Is it perfect? Nah. But it's definitely evolving, and who knows, maybe someday we'll be learning about the perfect biryani recipe via VR!
